meta: Focus on number sense, algebra readiness, and geometric reasoning

chapters.name: Large Numbers Around Us
agenda: Understand the scale of large numbers
Read, write and compare large numbers
Use estimation meaningfully in real life

session_instructions.text: Introduce large numbers using population, distance and data statistics
Students estimate large values from newspapers or online sources

divisions.name: Understanding Large Numbers
conceptual_understanding: Large numbers represent quantities beyond everyday counting
Place value defines the actual value of digits
student_can_achieve: Read and write large numbers correctly

divisions.name: Comparing and Ordering Numbers
conceptual_understanding: Comparison begins from the highest place value
Ordering helps understand relative size
student_can_achieve: Arrange numbers in ascending or descending order

divisions.name: Estimation in Daily Life
conceptual_understanding: Estimation helps judge reasonableness of results
Exact values are not always required

session_instructions.text: Explain arithmetic expressions using numbers and symbols
Students simplify expressions step-by-step using rules

divisions.name: What Is an Arithmetic Expression?
conceptual_understanding: Arithmetic expressions combine numbers and operations
Expressions must be evaluated, not solved

divisions.name: Order of Operations
conceptual_understanding: Operations follow a fixed priority order
Incorrect order leads to incorrect results

chapters.name: A Peek Beyond the Point
agenda: Extend number understanding beyond whole numbers

session_instructions.text: Introduce decimals as an extension of place value system
Use money and measurement contexts to visualize decimals

divisions.name: Understanding Decimals
conceptual_understanding: Decimals represent parts of a whole
Decimal place value extends the base-10 system

divisions.name: Comparing and Ordering Decimals
conceptual_understanding: Decimals are compared using place value alignment

divisions.name: Operations on Decimals
conceptual_understanding: Decimal operations follow the same rules as whole numbers
Place value alignment is critical

session_instructions.text: Explain letters as placeholders for numbers
Students convert word statements into algebraic expressions

divisions.name: Meaning of Variables
conceptual_understanding: Variables represent unknown or changing quantities
Letters generalize numerical relationships

divisions.name: Forming Algebraic Expressions
conceptual_understanding: Words can be translated into algebraic form

divisions.name: Evaluating Expressions
conceptual_understanding: Expressions take numerical value when variables are substituted

chapters.name: Parallel and Intersecting Lines
agenda: Identify angles formed by intersecting lines

session_instructions.text: Introduce line relationships using real-life road and railway examples
Students draw intersecting lines and measure angles

divisions.name: Types of Lines
conceptual_understanding: Parallel lines never meet
Intersecting lines meet at a point

divisions.name: Angles Formed by Intersecting Lines
conceptual_understanding: Vertically opposite angles are equal
Adjacent angles form linear pairs

divisions.name: Applications of Angle Relationships
conceptual_understanding: Angle properties help determine unknown angles

session_instructions.text: Introduce number properties through patterns and games
Students solve number puzzles collaboratively

divisions.name: Factors and Multiples
conceptual_understanding: Factors divide numbers exactly
Multiples follow regular patterns

divisions.name: Divisibility Rules
conceptual_understanding: Divisibility rules simplify checking division

divisions.name: Number Puzzles
conceptual_understanding: Logical reasoning improves problem-solving ability

chapters.name: Parallel and Intersecting Lines
agenda: Identify angles formed by intersecting lines

session_instructions.text: Introduce line relationships using real-life road and railway examples
Students draw intersecting lines and measure angles

divisions.name: Types of Lines
conceptual_understanding: Parallel lines never meet
Intersecting lines meet at a point

divisions.name: Angles Formed by Intersecting Lines
conceptual_understanding: Vertically opposite angles are equal
Adjacent angles form linear pairs

divisions.name: Applications of Angle Relationships
conceptual_understanding: Angle properties help determine unknown angles

session_instructions.text: Introduce number properties through patterns and games
Students solve number puzzles collaboratively

divisions.name: Factors and Multiples
conceptual_understanding: Factors divide numbers exactly
Multiples follow regular patterns

divisions.name: Divisibility Rules
conceptual_understanding: Divisibility rules simplify checking division

divisions.name: Number Puzzles
conceptual_understanding: Logical reasoning improves problem-solving ability

chapters.name: A Tale of Three Intersecting Lines
agenda: Understand intersections formed by three lines
Apply reasoning to complex angle problems

session_instructions.text: Explain how three lines intersect at different points with diagrams
Students draw three intersecting lines and label all angles

image_assets.name: Three Intersecting Lines and Angles
image_assets.relevant: Understanding angle relationships from multiple intersections

divisions.name: Intersections of Three Lines
conceptual_understanding: Three lines can intersect at one or multiple points
Each intersection creates unique angle sets

divisions.name: Angle Relationships
conceptual_understanding: Angle properties extend across multiple intersections
Known angles help determine unknown angles

divisions.name: Logical Reasoning with Lines
conceptual_understanding: Logical deduction is key in geometry proofs

chapters.name: Working with Fractions
agenda: Understand fractions as parts of a whole

session_instructions.text: Revise fraction concepts using visual models
Students solve fraction problems using strips and number lines

divisions.name: Understanding Fractions
conceptual_understanding: Fractions represent parts of a whole
Equivalent fractions represent the same value

divisions.name: Operations on Fractions
conceptual_understanding: Fraction operations follow specific rules
Common denominators simplify calculations
student_can_achieve: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide fractions

divisions.name: Applications of Fractions
conceptual_understanding: Fractions are used in daily life contexts
student_can_achieve: Apply fractions to measurements and sharing

session_instructions.text: Introduce science as a process of observation, questioning, and experimentation
Students list daily-life activities that involve scientific thinking

divisions.name: What is Science?
conceptual_understanding: Science is a systematic way of understanding the world
Scientific ideas change with new evidence

divisions.name: Science and Society
conceptual_understanding: Science improves human life
Technology is an application of science
student_can_achieve: Relate science to inventions and discoveries

chapters.name: Exploring Substances: Acidic, Basic, and Neutral
agenda: Identify acids, bases, and neutral substances

session_instructions.text: Explain acids and bases using familiar household examples
Students test substances using litmus or natural indicators

divisions.name: Acids
conceptual_understanding: Acids are sour and turn blue litmus red

divisions.name: Bases and Neutral Substances
conceptual_understanding: Bases are bitter and turn red litmus blue
Neutral substances show no change with indicators

divisions.name: Indicators and Uses
conceptual_understanding: Indicators help determine the nature of substances

chapters.name: Electricity: Circuits and their Components
agenda: Identify components of an electric circuit

session_instructions.text: Explain electric current using flow analogy and diagrams
Students assemble a simple circuit using a cell, wire, and bulb

image_assets.name: Simple Electric Circuit
image_assets.relevant: Understanding current flow in a closed circuit

divisions.name: Electric Circuits
conceptual_understanding: Electric current flows only in a closed circuit
A break in the circuit stops the flow of current
student_can_achieve: Explain what an electric circuit is

divisions.name: Components and Symbols
conceptual_understanding: Each circuit component performs a specific function
Circuit symbols represent real components

chapters.name: The World of Metals and Non-metals

session_instructions.text: Introduce metals and non-metals using everyday objects
Students classify classroom objects as metals or non-metals

divisions.name: Metals
conceptual_understanding: Metals are lustrous, malleable, and good conductors

divisions.name: Non-metals
conceptual_understanding: Non-metals are brittle and poor conductors

subjects.name: Changes Around Us: Physical and Chemical
agenda: Relate changes to daily life examples

session_instructions.text: Explain changes using simple demonstrations like melting ice and burning paper
Students classify given examples into physical or chemical changes

divisions.name: Physical Changes
conceptual_understanding: Physical changes do not form new substances
Most physical changes are reversible

divisions.name: Chemical Changes
conceptual_understanding: Chemical changes result in new substances
Most chemical changes are irreversible
student_can_achieve: Explain why a change is chemical

divisions.name: Reversible and Irreversible Changes
conceptual_understanding: Some changes can be reversed while others cannot

subjects.name: Adolescence: A Stage of Growth and Change

session_instructions.text: Explain adolescence sensitively with age-appropriate language
Students discuss healthy habits and emotional well-being

divisions.name: Physical and Emotional Changes
conceptual_understanding: Adolescence involves physical, mental, and emotional growth

divisions.name: Healthy Practices
conceptual_understanding: Balanced diet and hygiene are important during adolescence

subjects.name: Heat Transfer in Nature
agenda: Understand heat as a form of energy
Relate heat transfer to natural phenomena

session_instructions.text: Explain heat transfer using real-life examples like cooking and weather
Students observe and classify examples of conduction, convection, and radiation

divisions.name: Conduction
conceptual_understanding: Heat transfer through direct contact is conduction
Metals are good conductors of heat

divisions.name: Convection
conceptual_understanding: Heat transfer through fluids occurs by convection

divisions.name: Radiation
conceptual_understanding: Heat can travel through empty space by radiation

session_instructions.text: Explain motion using moving objects and timelines
Students measure time and distance of simple movements

divisions.name: Concept of Time
conceptual_understanding: Time measures duration of events

divisions.name: Motion
conceptual_understanding: Motion is the change in position with time

divisions.name: Speed and Its Measurement
conceptual_understanding: Speed relates distance covered to time taken

subjects.name: Life Processes in Animals
agenda: Understand essential life processes in animals
Learn how animals obtain and use energy

session_instructions.text: Explain life processes using simple animal examples
Students create flow diagrams of nutrition and respiration in animals

image_assets.name: Life Processes in Animals
image_assets.relevant: Understanding nutrition and respiration in animals

divisions.name: Nutrition in Animals
conceptual_understanding: Animals depend on other organisms for food
Nutrition provides energy for life activities
student_can_achieve: Identify examples of herbivores, carnivores, and omnivores

divisions.name: Respiration in Animals
conceptual_understanding: Respiration releases energy from food
Different animals respire differently

divisions.name: Circulation and Excretion
conceptual_understanding: Circulation transports substances in the body
Excretion removes waste products

subjects.name: Life Processes in Plants
agenda: Understand how plants make and use food
Learn transport of substances in plants
Relate plant processes to ecosystem balance

session_instructions.text: Explain photosynthesis using diagrams and sunlight examples
Students label plant diagrams showing transport and photosynthesis

image_assets.name: Life Processes in Plants
image_assets.relevant: Understanding photosynthesis and transport in plants

divisions.name: Photosynthesis
conceptual_understanding: Plants prepare food using sunlight
Chlorophyll plays a key role in photosynthesis

divisions.name: Respiration and Transport
conceptual_understanding: Plants respire to release energy
Water and food are transported through plant tissues

divisions.name: Importance of Plants
conceptual_understanding: Plants maintain oxygen and food balance

subjects.name: Light: Shadows and Reflections
agenda: Learn reflection of light and images

session_instructions.text: Demonstrate shadow formation using a torch and objects
Students observe shadows at different distances and angles

image_assets.name: Shadows and Reflection
image_assets.relevant: Understanding shadow formation and mirror reflection

divisions.name: Light and Shadows
conceptual_understanding: Light travels in straight lines
Shadows are formed when light is blocked
student_can_achieve: Identify opaque, translucent, and transparent objects

divisions.name: Reflection of Light
conceptual_understanding: Light reflects from smooth surfaces
Mirrors change the direction of light

divisions.name: Images in Mirrors
conceptual_understanding: Images formed by plane mirrors are virtual and upright

session_instructions.text: Explain day, night, and phases using globe and lamp model
Students model Moon phases using balls and light source

divisions.name: Earth and the Sun
conceptual_understanding: Rotation of Earth causes day and night
Revolution causes seasons

divisions.name: Phases of the Moon
conceptual_understanding: Moon phases result from its position relative to Earth and Sun

divisions.name: Human Use of Space
conceptual_understanding: Satellites help in communication and weather forecasting
